description: Self-care assessment for uncomplicated cold symptoms to support targeted OTC supply and safety netting.
inclusion: Adults and young people aged 12 years and over presenting with typical cold symptoms.
Mild upper respiratory symptoms less than three weeks in duration.
No signs of severe systemic illness or lower respiratory tract infection.
exclusion: Severe breathlessness or chest pain at rest.
High-risk immunosuppression or significant chronic lung disease exacerbation.
Symptoms persisting beyond three weeks or worsening after initial improvement.
safetyNetting: Seek urgent medical care if breathlessness, chest pain, or confusion develops.
Arrange GP assessment if symptoms persist beyond three weeks or significantly worsen.
Return for review if fever above 39Â°C lasts longer than 48 hours despite treatment.

questions.label: Current symptoms
questions.helper: Select all symptoms the patient currently has.

fail.label: Under 12 years - refer to GP/urgent care.

result.headline: Refer - age under 12 years
result.summary: OTC cold protocol covers patients aged 12 years and over.
actions: Signpost to GP or NHS 111 for age-specific review.

fail.label: Symptoms beyond three weeks - chronic course.

result.headline: Refer - symptoms beyond three weeks
result.summary: Persistent cold symptoms beyond three weeks require GP assessment.
actions: Arrange GP appointment to exclude secondary infection or other pathology.
Provide interim self-care advice while awaiting review.

warnings: Discuss smoking cessation support alongside symptom relief.
actions: Offer smoking cessation brief advice and refer to stop smoking services if appropriate.

warnings: Patient has not tried basic measures - explain non-pharmacological care.
actions: Cover hydration, rest, and hand hygiene advice before recommending medicines.

warnings: Underlying lung disease - monitor for exacerbation.
actions: Advise patient to use their rescue inhaler as prescribed and seek review if breathlessness increases.

pass.label: Red flag symptom - urgent referral required.

result.headline: Urgent referral - severe respiratory or cardiac symptoms
result.summary: Escalate immediately due to severe breathlessness or chest pain.
actions: Call 999/urgent care as appropriate and provide safety netting to family.

referral.reason: Cold presentation with red flag symptom

result.headline: Refer - immunosuppressed patient
result.summary: Requires GP assessment due to infection risk.
actions: Arrange GP follow-up within 24 hours and provide self-care advice.

pass.label: Symptoms beyond two weeks - consider GP review.

result.headline: Refer - prolonged symptom course
result.summary: Symptom duration beyond 14 days - arrange GP review.
actions: Book GP appointment to exclude sinusitis or secondary infection.
Reinforce nasal saline and analgesia while awaiting review.

pass.label: Mild symptom burden - focus on self-care support.

result.headline: Self-care advice - mild cold
result.summary: Reassure and provide symptomatic relief advice for mild cold symptoms.
actions: Recommend rest, fluids, and simple analgesia as required.
Discuss honey-based cough relief for adults and frequent hand washing.
Advise follow-up if symptoms worsen or new red flags appear.
safetyNet: Seek urgent care if breathlessness or chest pain develops.
Arrange GP assessment if symptoms persist beyond 3 weeks.

trace.label: Criteria met for OTC cold relief supply.

result.headline: Supply symptomatic relief pack
result.summary: Offer non-sedating decongestant or menthol inhalation with analgesia as required.
actions: Supply pseudoephedrine-free decongestant (e.g. xylometazoline nasal spray) for up to 7 days.
Recommend paracetamol or ibuprofen within licence for fever or pain.
Advise saline nasal rinses and rest; review if no improvement in 7 days.

supply.dosage: One spray in each nostril up to three times daily for a maximum of 7 days
supply.notes: Warn about rebound congestion if used beyond 7 days and avoid at bedtime due to stimulant effect.

safetyNet: Return if symptoms worsen, fever persists beyond 48 hours, or sinus pain develops.
Seek urgent care for sudden breathlessness, chest pain, or confusion.
